intro: Hieracium barasonense, commonly known as the Barasonense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium barasonense is often found in calcareous soils and can form dense colonies, sometimes becoming invasive in certain regions.
